Reviews.Title: “Very good place in a great location close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_traveler_70
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel location close to the Vatican. Price was very reasonable. Breakfast was good, quadruple room was great and fit us all very comfortably (2 adults + 2 children), the kids had proper single beds ! TV was small and channels limited. No internet in room. We came to this hotel after an awful experience in another hotel in Rome, staff was very helpful and nice (thanks Sara) at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “If your expecting a 4 star hotel probably dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Izza
Reviews.Content: Positives. The hotel is located in a fantastic location, an excellent start to sightseeing in Rome. The Vatican was close by and an easy walk. Not far away..also within walking distance are tour-buses where you can visit all the main attractions, the Colosseum etc by jumping on & off the bus at attractions you want to visit. Breakfast was included and was nice. Cost of the room was only $100.25AUD, so worth it for the location. Room was clean. Now the negatives. I stayed in a single room so expected small just not that tiny. Bathroom however was big. The hotel was nice but just not as grand or as amazing as the photos you see on internet sites. My room definitely did not look like any of the photos. But reading other peoples reviews it seems that certain areas of the hotel may be nicer, ie nicer room. I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star but overall had a great stay. Yes the room was tiny but you spend all your time sightseeing rather than in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, old, clean and in great location! Good value for people who don't demand luxurious amenities”
Reviews.Author: SpartyOn127
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend and was very satisfied! Of course, when I went to Rome I spent most of the time out of the hotel but I found the area to be safe and clean and very close to the Vatican area where our tourbus picked up . The hotel seems old and European style(small), but it was comfortable, clean, and affordable! They had a nice breakfast and friendly staff that held our bags after check out while we did our last-minute sight-seeing :-) grazie!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travellers, but still good for everyone else.”
Reviews.Author: themanwithnoshoes
Reviews.Content: Great location - can't beat it if you're planning on seeing the Vatican. Once you get to know your way about town you're looking at a 40 minute walk to the Collosseum and Termini, and no more than a half hour to the Pantheon. Rooms were functional - TV worked, as did the shower and hot water. Bed was comfortable. If I had to pick faults, then the room was a little hot (no air-con) and your couldn't close the curtains (so were woken up relatively early by daylight). Yes, the rooms are a little small, but as we planned on seeing Rome, and not the inside of a hotel room for our trip it really didn't bother us. Breakfast was good, especially considering it was included in the price, with a healthy variety to choose from. In summary I'd say it's perfectly suited to the business traveller and pretty much 'okay' for everyone else who doesn't expect 5* accommodation at a 3* price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shamrock2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Grand Olympic in a corner room which was very comfortable. It included a fridge, large wardrobe, desk, 2 night tables, excellent double bed, controls for outside blinds and lovely curtains. The shower was excellent and lots of towels. Breakfast was a lovely assortment tasty treats including cereal, croissants, yougurt, etc. Spacious living rooms to relax in off of the lobby and a computer to rent by the half hour. The best features of the hotel are its location across the street from an indoor market filled with homemade breads, cheeses, fruit, beer, and wine. The Olympic is a few blocks from the Vatican City and you can easily walk there in ten minutes. The subway stop is a 15 min. walk. It's also in the shopping district and there are lots of restaurants. We felt very safe walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Olympic Hotel leaves pleasant memories”
Reviews.Author: backcountrymom
Reviews.Content: The "Olympic" Hotel was a happy surprise on arriving in Rome. It is in a pleasant residential area, fairly near the Vatican, the "hop-on-hop-off bus" line and three blocks from an avenue of restaurants with in-street seatings. Even using a cane I was able to negotiate the distances. The friendly staff all spoke English, let us store our baggage in the office area until the room was ready, and made recommendations for dinner. Our air-conditioned room was spacious and clean with a comfortable bed, and the marble bathroom was luxurious. Breakfast was a buffet of pastries, fruit and eggs with great coffee and juices. I easily could imagine a distant time when "Papal palace" dignitaries called this home...

Reviews.Title: “Better places to be found”
Reviews.Author: taupoauckland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five nights, October 2011. Positives: Great location, clean, friendly and helpfull staff. Negatives: Rooms very small and in need of some maintainance. Shocking beds, had to change rooms after two nights as the bed springs made so much noise. Shower box very small. Booking stated full breakfast but far from it. Cereal, pasteries, cake and cold boiled eggs, no toast. Very dissapointed as have stayed in better and cheaper hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: an590
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone at the hotel for one night in late October and have no complaints whatsoever. My room was very spacious, as was the bathroom, and both were clean and in good condition. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly- they all spoke English- and they let me leave a bag with them for the good part of a day, after I'd checked out. The included breakfast is an extensive buffet- no hot food but there was still plenty of choice. The hotel is literally around the corner from the Vatican and is a convenient 5-10 minute walk from Ottaviano metro, making it easily accessible from Roma Termini. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect for the money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are polite and speak great english, the road hotel sits on is quiet and the windows are sufficiently glazed to keep any noise out. The room was pretty standard as European hotels go, not too small, not grand either, decent sized and reliably warm shower, all in room TV channels are Italian (not a massive deal, Postman Pat in Italian is pretty amusing). Breakfast was a real continental buffet, nice and easy to stock up on carbs and coffee first thing in the morning! Being near the Vatican means it's not too far to dine out within the vacinity for reasonable prices, it's also about 20-25 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps, around which there are heaps of places to eat. We didn't use public transport the whole time we were sightseeing, only from the Termini station to the Metro near the hotel when carting our luggage around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff.....room riddled with bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: ABUNDANT888
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel after the disaster of Hotel Beldes we were pleasantly surprised. All in all a great hotel, great location, literally around the corner from the Vatican and on the main shopping street. Easy to find your way about... Staff lovely, breakfast was OK, nothing spectacular.... BE WARNED!! BEDBUGS IN ROOM 118!! We got horrific bedbug bites our entire duration there, see pics attached. No-one in Italy will confirm anything with you, especially Doctors and pharmacists. We were using mosquito spray anyway, one of the best, nothing to report during the day in terms of bites, however when arising every morning the bed was full of little bedbug poos and blood stains and of course more bites. Please see photos attached. Shame as it was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel... do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieMS
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner were originally planned to stay in a hotel around the corner from this one but they had a problem with the electricity. Therefore, they placed us in this hotel for the night. This hotel is NOT a 4 star, in fact is more of a 2. The room we stayed in was the size of a shoebox, the shower flooded because the shower curtain wasn't long enough and the water didn't drain. The toilet seat was broken and the air con felt like it wasn't on... even though it was!!! Do not stay here unless you literally just want a bed for a night or 2, we were in Rome for 6 days and had we have booked this hotel then we would have checked out the next day. Only slight positive was the breakfast which was better than the hotel we ended up staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guest72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Vatican City and a distance from all the attractions in Rome, but it is close to the St. Peter's Basilica and Vatican Museum. We still walked everything because it is nice to see Rome on foot. If you want to take the metro, the closest station is about a 10 minute walk. The hotel itself is simple with no frills and there is not a lot to do at night in this neighborhood. It is listed as a 4 star hotel, but this is based on the European system and not the US system. In the US it would probably be a 3 star hotel. During the limited interaction we had with the staff because we were out all day, they seemed very friendly. Not everybody speaks English though, which made for some amusing interaction when I needed glasses and a bottle opener from the bartender. At the end we worked it out and he was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel as long as you are out most of the day exploring Rome and Vatican City and don't spend too much time in your hotel room, which would be an absolute waste of time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great quaint place at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulsea2525
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my entire family, we booked 5 rooms in total. check was easy, staff was friendly, rooms were small but clean. Who spends time in their room when in Rome. The area was safe, bathroom facilities were adequate and the price was amazing. if you are expecting an American type hotel then pay a ton of money and stay somewhere else. I don't understand all the complaints your in Italy - enjoy yourself!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2 star, clean but old and basic”
Reviews.Author: sheena10
Reviews.Content: Positive: Cheap, clean room, bed was comfy, larger bathroom, good venue for Vatican and metro, safe in room. Great deli round the corner and shops. Negative: small room, horrible shower, not enough toiletries for 2 (didn't even get more on day 2), not enough towels for 2, basic breakfast, rubbish and noisy air con and the worst hairdryer I've ever used ( very upset as deliberately had not taken one. Had to give up and tie hair up as it was useless). Mixed feelings about the reception staff. Mostly didn't speak English (not a major problem) but sometimes quite rude making you wait before serving you. Took 7am breakfast on last day and couldn't get served with cappucino as no-one around. Still - we had a fab holiday and loved Rome.

Reviews.Title: “More like poor, small & unimpressive - hotel”
Reviews.Author: partycular
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about a week in this hotel which has rated itself as a 4 star hotel and is in reality a 2 star hotel at its best. The room I got was on the ground floor, room #55, and was exactly the opposite of what the receptionist told me, very quiet. It was noisy in the daytime with cars driving by every second and in the evenings I experienced noisy guests getting to their rooms and talking in the hallway. The only reason I slept well was not due to the rooms ability to be "soundproof" but rather that I've walked several miles to see the different monuments. The room was somewhat clean but the shower head had some disgusting white coating on them. The breakfast buffet was uneventful especially after 7 days of the same poor breakfast. The service was terrible with rude receptionists, and you have to pay 2 euros for 30 min of internet time. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel is the location, it's close enough to the train station "Ottaviano" and to the Vatican (and a tip for those who want to visit the Vatican, there are ticket sellers everywhere outside the long line into the Vatican, they require 25 euros for a ticket but they only paid about 15 euros for it and I recommend standing in line instead of buying a ticket from them because you still have to wait in line to get in anyway. And it opens at 9 am so be there early.) I picked this hotel because it was "cheap" and I don't think the money was worth it at all, so I recommend you to pick another hotel if you have the budget for it because it might save you the pain of using your precious time complaining about this hotel on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: madsiluk
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind baby lizards in your room stay at this hotel! The front desk staff were absolutely unfriendly (verging on rude). When we brought our lizard to their attention, they started asked completely irrelevant questions! Also, there are no ironing facilities - quite surprising for a supposedly four star hotel. Terrible breakfast buffet. Very old premises. On a positive note, the hotel was within 5 minutes walk to vatican city and was quite inexpensive. Next time we will stay at a proper four star hotel even if it costs more. Will not be recommending this hotel to friends or business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good comfortable stay, would happily go back”
Reviews.Author: AS3MSC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to both the vatican and the vatican (ottaviano) metro stop, 2 minute walk max. As with all city breaks most people will spend most of the day out and about exploring the city seeing the sights and just be at the hotel to sleep. With that in mind the hotel fit its purpose very well, the rooms were average size for a city hotel, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was between 7 and 10 and there was a selection of 3 cereals (muesli, cornflakes etc), breads, pastries, boiled eggs,cheeses as well as milk, coffee and juice. I found the hotel to be good value for money, comfortable, clean and most importantly it had an excellent location. Just a quick tip, the hotel is located on via properzio, if you come out the hotel and turn left onto via cola di rienzo, keep walking straight down and then turn right onto via ottaviano, if you take the first road on your right via dei gracchi theres a greengrocers where you can buy fruit snacks and cheap water 1 euro for a 2 litre bottle. Theres also a cafe called rendez vous on the same road which has good food at a reasonable price and also free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Book Another Hotel - Not 4 Star- ( 2 Star )not well maintained!!!”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: We stayed with large group from USA and Canada we had complaints about the standard of rooms. ( This no were near 4 Star hotel.) 2 -3 Star at Best!! (When was last time the hotel was checked for star rating),. It location is good, but they don't seem to keep up with maintenance to hotel . The owner needs to spend money keeping the hotel up standard !!!. The breakfast is good by Italian standers.Normal Coffee and Don't look for good USA breakfast unless you pay good money at the any hotel. With their lackadaisical approach to consumer requirements, many Italian hotels offer little more than a few dry biscuits, a croissant and a hot drink. Some better establishments may offer a buffet with fruit, cereals, cheese and cold ham. A few times we've seen cooked eggs on offer, for an extra charge. If you stay in as many Italian hotels as we have, you dread the sight of the revolting sweetened watered-down orange juice invariably served, even at smart establishments, and the hideous 'fette biscottate': dried crunchy toast-like slices wrapped in cellophane. If you read hotel reviews, you'll see that foreign visitors almost always complain about the breakfasts served. We'd recommend you console yourself with the thought that you are paying less (no chefs cooking up eggs and bacon) and stop off at a bar to fill up on fresh pastries if you're still hungry. Lunch is traditionally an important meal in Italy; a light breakfast will ensure you can do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Olympic - Aurum Hotel Is Good”
Reviews.Author: jpatg
Reviews.Content: Before our Holland America M/S Noordam May 14, 2011 cruise, we spent a night at the Grand Hotel Olympic - Aurum Hotel, Via Properzio 2/a near the Vatican. The room was clean, nice, and quite adequate. The location was very good for us. It was easy walking distance (a few blocks) to the Vatican and a Metro stop. The front staff could have been a little more helpful in responding to our questions, but this was not a big problem. They did accommodate us for an early check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good But not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in the Vatican area, but certainly not 4 star, more like 3 star. It was easy to find from either the bus or metro and there are plenty of buses servicing the area, we took #40 from Termini, we arrived early and only had to wait 10 mins for our room to be ready. Plus Points Clean, spacious room Very quiet we slept well Ultra white bedding comfortable beds Plenty of storage space Lovely marble bathroom Nice public areas, spotless carpets Good filling breakfast Minus Points No spare electric sockets, we had to unplug the mini bar or TV Lack of toiletries in bathroom, only one soap and shower gel for 2 people ( I rely on these as I only travel with hand luggage) Awful machine coffee, ask staff for capuccino, much nicer The staff were pleasant and helpful, Maurizio the bar man was lovely and great fun, breakfast staff a little dead pan, but polite.. Overall it was a good stay and we got a good deal during the Beatification Ceremonies, most central hotels were double the price, it was spotlessly clean and efficient. It was the 1st time staying in this area for me in nine Rome visits, I found it a little far out from the historic center, though buses were frequent but the roads were very very busy here, guess I've been spoilt staying more central in the past. One thing that troubled me, we had a early pick up with Rome Cabs, we checked out and went for breakfast, I told the receptionist we were expecting our driver and if he came early could they tell them we were in breakfast. When we came up from breakfast our driver was waiting, the driver told me she asked after me at reception, but the receptionist said she knew no one of that name !??... the driver said thats what hotels do, hoping that you miss your pick up so then have to use their car service. It may just have been a misunderstaning, who knows.

Reviews.Title: “Narrow beds...”
Reviews.Author: LailaMStockholm
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is pretty good, close to metro, buses and trams. About 2 blocks from the Vatican. The rooms are kind of small but the worst part is the width of the beds. A singel-bed is no more then 80 cm. Everytime I turned I thought I would fall out of the bed. My father actually fell out on the last night and we are normally built... The breakfast was ok, nothing special. Otherwise the hotel is worn and not at all worthy of ****. Clean though and perhaps one should not expect more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not too bad considering the prices in Rome, anyway four stars for this structure is really not possible. Some problems during the stay that are just not episodic problems I guess. The breakfast also is not very good. More similar to a continental breakfast with some ham and cheese. Moreover, to taste some good cappucciono and croissant you have to go in a bar outside.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful, pleasant and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ravver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week whilst part of a larger group visiting Rome for the canonisation of Mary MacKillop. We found the check-in very quick and the reception staff very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay., The bedroom was on the 5th floor and we had some views across to St Peters. The room size was good enough for our needs and the toilet/shower room was large and very clean. The room was serviced every day, with clean towels left, and bed made etc. This is an old majestic building which has been refurbished about 10 years ago. We had no problems using the lift and found it useful as it takes you down to the breakfast room. Breakfast was typically continental with a selections of cereals; coffee or tea; rolls and croissants; jams, cheese, cooked ham and boiled eggs. Serving breakfast from 7am to 10am catered for all the different times we were going out. There is a bar service for guests operated by very pleasant staff and at very good prices. Although the hotel does not offer lunch or dinner, there are many restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance..and the Vatican is less than 10 minutes walk away. These range from good but higher priced restaurants to a large selection of bars, cheap restaurants and cafes. Round the corner is a market, a Spar small supermarket, and a wide selection of shops too. We didn't use buses or the Metro but they are close by...and the hotel staff are helpful in ordering taxis quickly. I think common in France and Italy, there are no kettle or tea-making facilities in the bedroom but there is a minibar. A good hairdryer was fitted in the bathroom. I noticed that the fire alarm system was quite new, comprehensive and maintained so the hotel owners are keeping things up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, old room, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AmandaLenhart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two positive points; it’s close to the Vatican, and it has a good breakfast that is included in the room. The hotel is very run down, and the staff is rude. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Bella2105
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. Expecting it to be pretty average we were happily suprised by our fantastic room and the brilliant location. A five minute walk from the Vatican, seven minutes to Ottiviano train station and in a very un-touristy part of Rome. Incredible value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: neekola
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for eight nights and would thoroughly recommend it. The staff are helpful and friendly, and the location is ideal. Our room was on the ground floor, and although during the day traffic noise could be heard, this was never an issue at nightime. The breakfast was decent continental but does not offer any hot option, even toast. The hotel was clean and tidy and a five-minute walk from the metro station ottaviano. The bathroom was not huge, and the shower was quite small but it served its purpose. I was slightly worried about staying here because of some of the reviews, but I absolutely loved it. Went travelling for three weeks, and stayed in three hotels and this was by far my favourite in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sens4life
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers, this is in no way a 4-star hotel, however the rooms have tall ceilings and strong air conditioning. The facility's biggest asset is its' location. Sitting between the Vatican and San Pietro metro station, both a approximately 5 minutes away by foot. There is no free Internet, just an over-priced computer in the lobby. Despite the disappointing tangibles, I'd still recommend it based on the surrounding neighbourhood. Staying so close to the Vatican state yet far enough from the noise is worth it in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4-Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: This place isn't a dump like some people are saying, but there is NO WAY, NO HOW it is a 4-star hotel!! You could debate whether it's 2-star or 3-star, but that's it!! (It probably should be a 3-star.) The location is very good if you want to spend a lot of time at the Vatican (which is what we wanted to do). It's also close to a metro station (which we didn't use). But it's on a noisy street and we didn't sleep very good, even with the windows closed. Now to the room itself. We had the "superior twin" room which was supposed to be bigger than the "standard twin", but it was still pretty small. However the bathroom was HUGE!! (go figure) The TV was maybe 13 inch from the 1980s. And no WiFi at all (free or otherwise). The breakfast was very basic, like a 2-star hotel would serve. The rooms, although small, were similar to a European 3-star hotel, not bad but nothing really to brag about. There is a bar where we watched some World Cup matches and I liked it. We stayed 4 nights which was too many and we ended up with some sleep deprivation issues due to the outside noise (and we were on the 3rd floor!!). The beds were very small but fairly firm. The price was about $150/night US which was not bad for the area. But if I had to do it over, I would have paid more for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to enjoy the sights of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AnonLondonuk
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried about this hotel choice once i had read all the bad comments on here, however they were completly wrong. This hotel was perfect for a few days in Rome. The room including bathroom was clean and comfortable and the staff were more than helpful. I cannot comment on breakfast as I always ate out. I think the people giving the bad reviews should have spent less time looking for faults with the hotel and more time getting out and enjoying Rome. It is a five minute walk from the vatican and although a bit of a walk, possibe to walk to the Colosseum and the other sights along the way. It is possibe to do a bus tour from the hotel if you dont want to walk, and the ticket is valid for either 24 or 48 hours. This ticket entitles you to get off and on at all the major sights with information along the way. It is also possible to get a bus to and from the airport to Piazza Cavour, which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel and only costs 8 Euros each way. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a Terrible, place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: europetripsandmore
Reviews.Content: Let me me start from a positive side, it is locate within walking distance to the Vatican. on the hotel, horrible, dont stay pay a little extra a stay somewhere nicer, the four star rating is highly incorrect. maybe a one star. the shower where so small half my body was outside in order to take a bath. my wife who is 5''3' 107lbs, could not fit in the shower. buffet breakfast was a joke, skip it. the room was real small, i am from germany and i stayed in small hotels/pensions but this hotel rooms where really small, and you could hear you neighbor conversation and in middle of the night one can hear the flushing of the toilets down the hall. bottom line regardless how much you will be in your room, nothing beats returning to your hotel and enjoying a good nights rest. but this is not the place. the pictures in the web site or expedia are highly inaccurate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in all my years of Travel”
Reviews.Author: Diana114
Reviews.Content: Wow--this was such a bad experience, I do not know where to begin! One positive point, we were able to check in early.....and it was in close proximity to several tourist hot spots. The air conditioning is controlled by the hotel and the thermostat was set at a nice 90 degrees or better. It was so hot in that room that we had to sleep with wet washrags on our bodies. Requesting a temperature reduction fell on deaf ears. The room was clean, but very dated. The bathroom facilities were adequate, but do NOT turn on the antiquated hair dryers (mounted on wall with flexible tubing)! Ours would not turn off, so it blew hot air into the bathroom, adding to the temperature of the room. We were able to get someone from the staff to come to the room in about an hour but they could not turn it off either, so they "disconnected" it. At about 3 a.m. it decided to connect itself again and started blowing hot air into our room. It was hilarious, but very sad at the same time. We got a really great deal on the room, but I guess it is true, YOU ALWAYS GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! I would highly recommend skipping this hotel in favor of a chain with proper air conditioning if you are traveling in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to see Rome and the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: benztraveler
Reviews.Content: First off...the price was right. When we travel we look for a hotel that is safe, provides breakfast, has a comfortable bed, and a good shower. The Grand Olympic provided all of these. As we only spend a few hours in the room, mostly asleep, I could not tell if there were cracks in the walls or if there were stains on the carpet. The room we had was large by Eurpoean standards and the bathroom was functional. The only real downside was that there was only one old creeky elevator. The hotel was about 3 blocks from the metro, but walking distance to St Peter's, the Vatican Museum, and Castle San Angelo. There are plenty of restraunts in the area as well as shopping. If you are on a budget or just don't want to spend alot on a room you are just going to sleep in then you may want to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: greathotelseeker79
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I am left wondering if the hotel paid its staff to write them. We stayed in a small room on the second floor. There was no air conditioning to speak of, the walls and ceilings had damage from things hitting them and water, and the bathroom was small. The shower had mold and the shower head was completely crusted with build-up and the shower drain was completely clogged. We had some issues flushing the toilet if it had been flushed within the last 2 hours, and the room had a faint musty smell. The window lock was broken, so we were left feeling slightly unsafe at night. We reported the shower mold and clogged drain to the reception who reassured us it would be fixed immediately. The shower looked basically the same when we returned that night and their idea of fixing the drain was to just remove one part of it and set it in the corner. The breakfast is okay at best. There is a lot of food, but you can tell all of it is unthawed and reheated for the morning. The coffee was some of the worst I have ever had, and they put out the meat and cheese platters once, at 7am and they sit there until breakfast ends at 10am. We were very disappointed by this hotel, especially since it claimed to be a 4star hotel and cost us over 200 US dollars a night. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Julie78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for the first part of our anniversary trip to Italy. The location is the best part about the hotel. It's an easy walk to the metro and Vatican City. So you can pretty much get to any place in Rome. (Once we figured out the metro.) The rooms themselves were pretty small. The bathroom was a good size. The only ventilation for the shower steam was the window. But since there wasn't an ironing board we used the "steam room" effect to get the wrinkles out of our clothes. The hair dryer in our room was a joke. It was this tube design that had virtually no power. I have long hair so having to spend 45 minutes to dry it was an inconvenience. The breakfast they provided was good-just remember that typical italian breakfasts aren't your standard American fare. There were cold cuts, cheese, bread, cereal, croissants, coffee, etc. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: eChouChou
Reviews.Content: Short 5-10 min. walk to Vatican and metro station, particularly good for early morning visit to the Vatican museum, which could be long line from 8am. The room was nice and clean, bathroom was spacious but drainage may blocked during shower. Nice breakfast buffet, including bread, cold meat, egg, cereal, cake, juice, milk, coffee etc. The staff were kind and many nice cafes around. The only thing I don't like is there was no place to secure the luggage if arriving before check-in time. People just left the luggage in the lobby in front of the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - away from tourists”
Reviews.Author: bella235
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel within walking distance to the vatican and metro station. The neighbourhood is safe and offers a very unique italian stay. Markets are only 50 metres away as well as a number of fantastic cafes and shops. ideal place to stay if you dont want to be surrounded by tourists and enjoy what rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: donnass
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. Hotel room was very small, to include the shower, had issues flushing the toilet, however the room was cleaned every day. The hotel location was pretty much walking distance to almost all of the sites, which was good and there was also bus 81 nearby if you did not feel like walking. The staff was friendly and we had no complaints up until it was time for us to pack and leave. During the time we were there, we did not want to travel with all of our documents in the event my purse was snatched or something. The safe was not securing well, so we decided to walk with our passports and leave our wallet and one cell phone in the room tightly hidden away in our suitcase in the closet. While packing the night before our departure, we noticed the wallet and phone were missing. We looked everywhere, ransacked the room over and over, search dirty clothing, under the beds, everywhere. Our only conclusion was that the cleaning person took our belongings. We had no proof of this; however we knew exactly where we had put our documents (credit cards, ATM cards, driver’s license, student ID card, and military ID cards etc.) This was frustrating because now we had to cancel all credit cards, debit cards and cell phone. We also had to call long distance on my cell phone because the hotel desk phone would not allow us to dial to the states. We called the police to file a report and they would not come to the hotel because it was late, so now we had to walk five blocks to the police station to make a report. Thanks to one of the guest who was on business from Barcelona, helped us throughout this ordeal, he even allowed us to drive in his taxi the next day to the airport. Needless to say, the hotel was not much help and did not even seem to be concerned. We called the Manger who was out at the time and explained what happened, she told us to give them the police report and we will get the money back for our phone and that was all they could do. We are still waiting to see if they will actually give us our money for the phone. Rome was definitely beautiful and we would do it again, but will not stay in this hotel. I know sometimes one cannot control what employees do, however for the hotel not to show any concerned was really disappointing. Another thing I found interesting was the fact that the front desk clerk knew what we had taken out of the room refrigerator without us even telling him. At the time of check out, the desk clerk told me exactly what I had owed him for from the fridge; I did not even fill out the form with the items. That was a mystery to me. I f you want to stay in this hotel, I would think twice because you never know when someone will actually take the time and effort to go into your room, into a closet and into a suitcase to steal your belongings, and to have a manger who shows no concern what so ever. I was more worried about getting robbed in the streets rather than in my own hotel rrom. What a big dissapointment hotel Olympic.

Reviews.Title: “When I Come Back to Rome, Here's Where I'm Staying!”
Reviews.Author: Anon-E-Muss
Reviews.Content: The Grand Olympic - Aurem is a clean, family-friendly hotel located just a short walk from the Vatican and the Ottaviano Metro stop. The staff were very kind and helpful and the rooms and bathrooms were spacious and clean. For budget travellers (like me), I particularly liked the fresh meat and produce market located less than 75 meters from the hotel entrance, and a Coin (gorcery store chain) located about two blocks away. The surrounding neighborhood is also quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: reci
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a GREAT location and great air conditioning (very important for the summer)! I was a little disappointed that they didn't have water at breakfast, but other than that their selection was a typical continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: donjaime24
Reviews.Content: Good location. Nice and clean rooms, close to everywhere just walking. Good breakfast: Very recommended for trips where you need a room just to rest in.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you want to be near the vatican”
Reviews.Author: cauchemars
Reviews.Content: Good location and safe area, but area closes up early and not much to do in the surrounding area once the Vatican is closed. Mini bar was warm and told management, they said that it would be tended to, but they never did. Breakfast was absolutely terrible, and not worth hanging around for. Furnishings very old and air conditioning not very cold. On the positive side, room was very clean, staff very friendly and paid about $200 U.S. a night for a quadruple room.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler3636
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Vatican and were encouraged by the generally favorable reviews from other travelers. We ended up wondering how some of the reviewers were able to find positive things to say. We did not get a great rate here (we paid nearly 300 Euros per night) so perhaps our expectations were in line with the price, but the hotel's interior and our room were comparable to what you would expect to see alongside a rural US highway for $59/night. Our room looked nothing like the rooms in the photos that the hotel has provided for online travel sites. The furnishings and linens were very old. Of the two beds in the room, one had a mattress that sank appreciably and left you feeling as though you were sleeping on a boxspring, and its sheets had holes in them. The other bed felt as if someone had buried a basketball underneath the center of it. There was mildew on the shower doors and a thick layer of dust collected on the carpeting between pieces of furniture and the walls. The TV did not work at all. There were some Stick-Ups in the room that were supposed to freshen the air, but the air was probably best described as stale. We had to keep our window open for air conditioning (the thermostat on the wall didn't seem to be functional) and there was a fair bit of street noise at night. The seating in the lobby area was shabby and appeared quite old. The front desk staff were OK, not remarkable one way or the other. Breakfast is served in the basement and after taking a quick look at it we decided to head out to a nearby cafe instead. On the positive side, the hotel is close to the Vatican museums and is situated on a nice street that is is brightly lit at night. There were several electrical outlets in the room, which made it easy to charge phones, etc. We would have been fine with this hotel if we had paid a bargain price for it, but we found the accommodations unfitting of the rate we paid and we found the hotel's photos on travel sites to be very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel problems need to be addressed creatively”
Reviews.Author: OpaOma72
Reviews.Content: My party used 3 rooms for 6 nights. We were told by staff upon arrival, not to leave anything unattended at our breakfast table because of security issues. What an introduction that was. Also on the first day, in one of the rooms that was rented to us, the toilet had overflowed prior to our arrival and the bathroom was wet with the overflow. Management response was "the hotel is full, we will change your room tomorrow". No attempt to offer compensation, not even a bottle of wine was made. On the last 2 days, the elevator was out of service. Our 3 room were on the 5th floor. Again, no attempt to offer compensation was made. A bottle of water from the stocked refrigerator gratis, would have been appreciated on one of our trips up and down those stairs. On the last day, we all had to carry our luggage down the 5 floors at 6 AM because luggage staff did not arrive until 7 AM. Finally, the breakfast was poor quality. Coffee was cool, the staff offered no assistance at all and table cloths were not clean for our breakfast. I think compensation for these problems IS STILL appropriate. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy, Cheerful and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: HappyPaws
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted to have a girlfriend getaway to Rome for 3 days and we found this hotel through a travel website. Our husbands warned us that the low price meant it would be a pretty bad place, but we decided to risk it. We were really happy with the hotel. They were expecting us when we arrived and we were greeted cheerfully and quickly. The view from the room was good: it overlooked a busy street where we could see the hustle and bustle of the city. The bathroom was clean with plenty of soap and fresh towels. The front desk recommended a restaurant around the corner for lunch which was delicious, inexpensive and friendly and we ended up eating there twice. We were very close to the Vatican and lots of restaurants and stores. It was an easy walk across the Tiber River into the ancient part of the city, and the metro that brought us back was not far from the hotel. The metro was really crowded and we would not recommend it as a primary way to travel. The Big Bus Tour was much more comfortable. We were exhausted at the end of each day and the beds were nice and comfy. Breakfast was good--nothing fancy, but an easy way to start the day. We would definitely come back to this hotel with our families or on another getaway holiday with a friend. We would want something more upscale if we came on a romantic holiday with our husbands.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: LK59
Reviews.Content: This was the first of 5 hotels on our recent trip to Italy. I found it to be adequate and clean. It was an easy walk from the Ottaviani metro stop and near the Vatican. Our room was a little larger than the average Italian hotel room and had good closet storage. I would stay here again, although I might look for something closer to Termini station just for travel convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kpangel68
Reviews.Content: What an excellent Hotel! My friend and I stayed for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The hotel was well located, 5 minute walk to the metro, 5 minute walk to St. Peters. I have to commend the staff, they are the friendliest hotel staff I have ever dealt with. Rooms were a good size and spotlessly clean. Great breakfast and I especially loved the coffee. Great market across the street from the hotel which supplied fresh fruit, veg, bread, hams and cheeses. Any amount of great restaurants nearby very reasonably priced. Also great shops as well. Would recommend this hotel and will stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars?? please, divide by 2 !!”
Reviews.Author: Mista-go
Reviews.Content: I regret that I haven't taken any pictures of the room during my one-week stay, infact now that I look at the images that other users posted on this I feel like I took crazy pills!! I don't quite recognize the hotel !!!! Please note that I booked 8 (!!!) rooms for my colleagues (we were in Rome for a convention), so I think this is a very good range to get one's ideas straight. All the rooms (except three of them) were located on the ground floor and the majority of them were facing a filthy, narrow lane on the back of the hotel. We asked the receptionist to change our accomodation, but she told us that there was no room available in the whole building (PS ...but during our stay we saw only a few guests apart from us...). I must admit that I was not surprised at all, as the female receptionist wasn't friendly at all. The bartender, on the contrary, was really nice and helpful. The room was dark, small, and the walls were dirty (it seemed like someone had been walking "WALKING" on them!). The toilet was tiny and had a very bed lighting. The only things I liked about the hotel were the location (ideal if you plan to have shopping nearby) and the breakfast (quite abundant buffet, even if not excellent in quality). 4 stars??????????????????? I would say 2 and half....

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ketchup888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Olympic Aurum for 2 nights. It was a good hotel if a bit bog standard compared to the other hotels we had stayed in. The staff were polite and courteous. We had a quadruple room which was a good size even for 2 adults and 2 young teenagers. The hotel had the best air conditioning out of the all the hotels we stayed in in Italy controlled rather like the central heating thermostat back home in England. The beds were very clean and comfortable. The decor and style of the hotel were nothing special though. You could have been in any city or country even. One of the best things during our stay was the free parking you get at the weekend. We had expected Rome to be full of crazy cars and full of people. However it was August Bank holiday and apparently the Romans had left the city to the seaside which made the city very pleasant and easy to drive in. We could park just outside our hotel which made it very convenient. It is a short walk from the Vatican. I didn't see many restaurants close by during our stay though. However, it is just as nice going somewhere busy to eat such as the Piazza Nuovena as there's such a nice atmosphere and vibe. Overall, a good value for money hotel in a good location away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a really good location”
Reviews.Author: Hatt-away
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times before, so that shows that I like this hotel. I like the location as it is on a great street in rome and there are some fantastic places to eat close by. The hotel is reasonably priced for central rome and the rooms are comfortable - but I do always book a superior, which gives you more space. I have to say this time I noticed some nice new touches in the room (electric blinds and new fridge). The bathrooms are always on the small side in rome, but this one was well proportioned with a large shower. The cleaners do a wonderful job and the room was spotless as always. Breakfast is basic bread, cheese, cereal etc. You can do a lot worse than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location for exploring rome”
Reviews.Author: stacefaceIreland
Reviews.Content: this hotel is reasonably priced and in a very good location . the rooms are clean and comfortable with air conditioning . the staff were friendly and very helpful. Only slight drawback the hotel only offers continental breakfast which my children did not find to their taste, this was also the only meal served in the restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dont believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: BarefootgalLondon
Reviews.Content: I was seriously worried when I looked up reviews after having booked this hotel but luckily my boyfriend and I were very pleasantly suprised. While it may not be up to 4 star standard as some of the other reviews have stated - our room was spacious, clean and aside from lepoard print head-board the decor was very tasteful. The only downside was that the bolier broke and we had no hot water for the 1st few hours of our stay - however this was very quickly resolved by polite hotel staff who kept us well informed. When we slept in one morning the breakfast room was even opened especially for us. All in all a very good place and execellent location for visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money!”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler52
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome many times, and normally stay at 4 star hotels in the center of Rome. After reading reviews about this property, decided to try a 3-star. This hotel alleviated all of my fears. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood (Prati), and while only a few blocks to the Vatican, it's much less 'toursity' than the center. Many great restaurants are within a few blocks. We were upgraded to a larger double room. While the rooms are not spacious, they are average for Europe, and great for the price. Plumbing and A/C worked adequately, and although this hotel is located on a fairly busy street, the room was very quiet. Room was very clean, and beds were comfortable. Hotel front desk staff was helpful and efficient. The lobby looks a little worn, and the breakfast buffet was great, with the exception of the coffee. But, just a few steps down the street at the local bar will get you a great cappucino of caffe of your choice, for just 1 euro or so. Great stay for the price, and would definitely visit again for a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: clangirl
Reviews.Content: We had a good deal with this hotel by booking direct in advance on their website otherwise we would have been sorely disappointed. On the plus side the hotel is wonderfully placed for the Vatican and Piazza Risorgemento for easy access to Metro, Trams and buses. Also good area for eating. The hotel is clean although I have to say that we booked a 'Superior' room and I think the room decor is rather strange. On the minus side the hotel lift broke down every day for each of the 5 days we were there so DO NOT choose this hotel if you suffer with mobility problems. Breakfast was ok as Italian breakfasts go but every day there was something missing and the fruit juice was just disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gillian63
Reviews.Content: Plus points: 5 minutes from the Vatican; excellent shopping on doorstep; easy to walk to main attractions; VERY clean rooms, especially bed linen and towels; good breakfast choice (coffee/tea, fruit juices, croissants, rolls, cereal, cheese, meats, tinned fruit, yoghurt, cakes); friendly staff. Negative points: Looks a bit tatty - the hotel could do with some love and attention! The reception area is fine but staircases, walls, ceilings could be better. Families liked this hotel so it did get a little noisy at times!

Reviews.Title: “5 mins from Vatican”
Reviews.Author: noplanb
Reviews.Content: The Olympic is just 5 mins walk from the Vatican so great to get to the Basilica for first thing in the morning (the view from the dome is amazing). It's also a five minute walk to the nearest metro (Ottaviano). For all the other sites, it is better to stay more centrally, near the Trevi Fountain. The hotel isn't really a 4 star. The rooms are basic but clean. The staff are friendly and helpful but there isn't really a personal touch. Some of the rooms are on a main road so can be noisy. The breakfast is better than most in Rome with much more choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best.”
Reviews.Author: freefly1
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at the Grand Olympic for 2 nights in Sept. of 2007. The location was good but after a couple of days we were ready to leave. Bottom line: Close to Vatican and metro. Room was fairly spacious. Safe in room. Poor shower. Mold in room and bathroom. Very small TV (not like it matters while in Europe but after a day of walking around Rome it is nice to kick back with a decent TV). Breakfast was average at best. We would not stay here again however if you get a reasonable deal then it is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly NOT 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: IrishGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend at all. Massively overpriced for what it is - 2/3 star at best. Dingy - certainly not four star. We were not informed of work going on during our stay. Workers started hammering at 8.00 a.m. Asked at reception for a bulb in the bathroom to be replaced. Wrote it down (or did they?) but it never was repalced. Indifferent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Euroweekender
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner had a weeks stay in Rome at this hotel. We were a little aprehensive due to the mixed reviews but were pleasantly surprised at how pleasant our stay was. The rooms are of a good size, bathrooms large and spacious, air-con worked perfectly well - small tip ensure bathroom door is closed if you want full use of the air-con. The breakfast room though not large was big enough for the traffic of guests, plenty of breakfast items to choose from. The picky reviews were over the top - it may not be 100% 4 star but certainly better than a lot of four star hotels I have stayed in in Britain! It is not a big hotel but we would definitely use it again, as it was well located fro Metro (10mins walk), Vatican (6 mins walk). There are two reasonable retaurants close to the hotel for evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....but could be a lot better !!”
Reviews.Author: AndyBest
Reviews.Content: Had a romantic long weekend at this hotel (2nd to 6th August 2007). The hotel is ideally located for all the tourist areas of Rome, particularly the Vatican which is 5 minutes walk just around the corner. The basic structure of the building is very nice, with marble floors and high ceilings. The carpets, curtains and internal furnishings of the corridors and bedrooms are however, a little tired. There are nice touches in service, the sheets and towels are all renewed every day. There was an electric powered shutter on the outside of our bedroom window, and I'm sure if it had worked properly it would have made our room nice and dark for that relaxing lie-in. No tea or coffee making equipment is provided in the room, though there is a mini-bar. I appreciate that buying from the mini-bar is often expensive, but we were charged an extortionate 12 euros (about £8 or $16) for a small bottle of water (500ml). Far better to buy from the small shop at the market entrance opposite the hotel, where you can get 1 ltr for only 1 euro. Bedrooms are small but clean, as are the even smaller bathrooms, though the tiles were cracked, as was the tray of the shower cubicle. Don't expect nicities like complimentary shower gel, shampoos or shower cap etc.....take everything you may possibly need. Staff are pleasant and usually helpful. Breakfast is provided as a continental buffet in the basement between 7 and 10am every day. I advise anyone to go early, or late, as the peak time between 8 and 9am you'll do well to get a table. There simply aren't enough for the number of people staying there. On the whole the hotel was adequate for our needs. If you can manage to get a cheap 'deal' then the hotel would be good value. The location, the structure of the building, and the service of most of the staff give this hotel the possibility of being somewhere special to go and stay in Rome. It just needs the parent company Aurum to spend a little money on the furnishings, then they may aspire to the 4 star rating they claim.

Reviews.Title: “thought it was great!!”
Reviews.Author: galingor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome yesterday afternoon - this is the second time we've been to Rome this year - stayed in a different hotel first time which was fantastic - Grand Olympic Aurum Hotel was also good - we had a quadruple room which was very clean - bathroom was luxurious - we were shown to our room on arrival - staff very friendly and helpful - breakfast excellent - air conditioning worked extremely well - this was excellent especially as it was 38 degrees outside!!! Excellent location shops good and we found a lovely restaurant opposite the hotel down a side street - so good that we ate there three times during our 4 night stay!!! Yes the walls were covered in a fuzzy fabric but we thought this was cosy - strange thing though - was it only us that could see faces in the ceiling? A face with a fringe, wearing sunglasses, long hair and other 'patterns' on the ceiling as well?? Very interesting!! However, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal But Old and Hot. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: kangaroojoe
Reviews.Content: Very good location near the Vatican. Staff were nice. Rooms were quite large for Rome and rates were very reasonable. The hotel is old but in good shape. The only real problem was the air conditioning. Typcial non-functioning Roman a/c which was almost unbearable in June.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: pigchops
Reviews.Content: 'Adequate' sums up this hotel Many have written terrible reviews about this hotel - these are a bit OTT and the place is nowhere near as bad as they have suggested. What it is true, though, is that this hotel is misrepresented as a 4-star hotel; it would struggle in Engalnd to get one or two stars but it is kept clean and does the basic job. Most Rome hotels are over-priced for what they are, so this one is no different in that respect. I had a single room which was very small and prison-cell like. It needed a lick of paint but the bed was new and reasonably comfortable, if very small. The double rooms look more spacious, however. The breakfasts were adequate. Would have been better had they offered some fresh fruit and fruit salads instead of the unhealthy white bread-based fare - but Italians are not into healthy eating!

Reviews.Title: “positive review”
Reviews.Author: springingahead
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Olympic in Rome last week for just one night (on business) and quite honestly before arriving I shared the trepidation of some of the other reviewers, having read such negative comments about the hotel. My experience was positive - excellent location (especially to the Vatican) - spacious enough rooms - pleasant lobby and service - quiet setting - reasonable price - the color on the walls wouldn't be my first choice, but then again, I don't own the hotel - anyhow, please rest assured that the Olympic is a good-enough European 4-star hotel and I can recommend it to anyone who doesn't need to "put on the Ritz." Having spend 50 or more nights-a-year in hotels all-over-the-world for more than 30 years, I can't grasp the many negative reviews about this hotel. It's just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Olympic Aurum”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamShamrock
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there last weekend and I too was worried about it having read the previous comments. We had a great stay! Yes, the decor is slightly outdated and the breakfast basic - but the staff were helpful. In fact they helped us to find an accommodation solution for my brother and his family who arrived in Rome with no booking and no available rooms anywhere we tried. The location is excellent and we got great recommendations for restaurants. I would definitely stay there again. I stayed in another hotel around the corner last time, that was meant to be a 5 star - but found the Olympic to have better staff and the room was clean and large enough. I think they have some 'new' rooms - so best to ask if you can stay in one of them. I've also always found it best to double check bookings in Italy by calling beforehand and making sure your requests have been noted.

Reviews.Title: “A Well-Located Dump”
Reviews.Author: ottogard
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Grand Olympic as part of our tour of Italy. The only good thing about the hotel is the location - 10 minute walk to the Vatican and to the metro (subway), and near shopping and restaurants. The hotel is a dump - small room, small and old TV, lumpy pillows, and uncomfortable (soft) mattress. Cigarette smoke from other rooms wafted into our room, possibly through the ventilation system. The lock to the door was hard to open. Would not recommend unless you want to pay a reasonable price for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Silver medal -Not a bad result.”
Reviews.Author: R.C.Nesbitt
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in a single room,which although small, had a comfortable (double) bed, luscious wallpaper and a window. The bathroom was well tiled, mirrored and clean. The hotel looked very well maintained with decent furnishings. The Desk staff were quite 'highhanded', but not rude,though one of the younger ladies was absolutely no help when I phoned to say I would be late arriving on my 1st night. The breakfast was the basic one you get in Roman Hotels, the coffee wasn't great, though the bread rolls are of the usual hotel and restaurant standard. Theres a market (mainly fruit) opposite-and a coffee and snacks shop across the road and about 20 yards down from the market. Its quite an upmarket area,so there's no threat in walking around at night. There are restaurants round about, with quite a swanky one on the street at the back of the market. My personal tastes are more downmarket ie cheaper, so I made 2 trips to Dino & Tonys Trattoria on Via Leone IV 60 (about half a mile away) where I had a massive and excellent Antipasti, and a cracking all 'amatriciana with 500ml of excellent house red for 19 Euro..Top class food. The Hotels also handy for the Vatican museum and St Peters. So its a good base for several days, but if you're in Rome for longer you may consider a 2nd hotel to experience another area of town.

Reviews.Title: “They win the gold medal in........”
Reviews.Author: spayandneuter
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs, Dirty bathrooms, Over flowing and moldy showers, disgusting and rough sheets, springs poking through the flimsy mattresses. Furthermore, to make matters worse their hateful attitudes topped any that we encountered in Italy. When we checked in, We were told that our bags were to be delivered to our "room." After an hour and half with no bags I went downstairs to see where they were. They were sitting by the front door unattended. I told the front desk gentleman that they wre mine and I was taking them to the room. Despite the fact that he spoke no English, he was hostile and acting as if I was an inconvience. And that was just the first 2 hours of our stay. I could write for days about what a disgrace this hotel is. I would rather stay home than to ever stay in this slum again. We are back in the States and still itching from the filth in which we had to sleep. And trust me..they don't care. I told the manager that I had found a spider in our bed and his sarcastic response was," What do you want me to do??? There are spiders everywhere.." Do your self a favor and do not stay here. It was by far our worst travelling experience ever... Gold metal for the worst excuse hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Itsy Bitsy Teeny Weeny”
Reviews.Author: bindiboo
Reviews.Content: We were booked to be in a quad room and found they changed our reservation when we arrived to two singles and one double. The rate was kept the same (reasonable)Thank goodness my children were old enough to stay in rooms by themselves! The rooms were so tiny we literally had to step over our luggage all the time. Towels were small and there were too few. They were not changed each day. The worse thing was the absence of decent air conditioning. The rooms were so hot all the time! I was not expecting a dream palace, but a three star hotel listing should have been adequate at least. The breakfast was a joke; in a land of exquisite coffee, theirs was undrinkable. The bars nearby were great! Thank goodness we only showered and slept in the hotel. The location was fabulous, but I would not go back!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating lack of response to our specific requests. Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sue W
Reviews.Content: It was very, very difficult to make a reservation at this hotel. You can do it only on the web and have no idea if you will get your requested type of beds or the court-yard location of your room, if you use AOL as your service provider. We had to make many, many phone calls to the hotel itself, who said they couldn't help us, and the reservation center in Naples, before we received a confirmation of our reservation. They told us they cannot send confirmations to people on AOL! We booked this hotel because of its proximation to the Vatican - just 3 blocks away. Our room opened on to the very busy street below and it was very noisy if you tried to leave your window open to get some air. We specifically requested a court-yard room but were ignored. Two days before our arrival, when we called the hotel again, we were told we had the bed types we requested. Other than its location and the nice bathrooms, this hotel has no redeeming qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - cheap and basic”
Reviews.Author: LizzyO
Reviews.Content: Ok - i have read some of the reviews about this place and they are not exactly glowing. Personally, i found the hotel basic, but clean, very cheap and very well located - just what i was looking for. It is right near Vatican city (about 5 mins walk) - so if that is the main reason for your trip and you don't want to spend too much money, this is the place to stay. There were three of us (girls) and we got a triple room. The room was fine - a bit dark (dark velvet wallpaper!) and quite warm at night time, but the bathroom was really good. We had two sinks, so two of us could be in bathroom at the same time cleaning teeth/brushing hair/putting on make up etc. Shower was good too. Oh - and if you like hot chocolate and cakes - come out of hotel, turn left, go to end of street and turn right - a few shops down is the most amazing cake/tea/coffee/hot chocolate shop around! We only discovered it on the last day and said if we had discovered it sooner - we would have gone there loads more. But i have to admit - breakfast a bit basic and staff were average - heard them giving out to one other woman a bit unnecessarily. All in all i recommend, but i guess we were lucky.

Reviews.Title: “God value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We statyed here 4 nights. Our room was large (for Europe) and comfortable. There were some small cleaning problems but nothing that was of great signifgance. The bed was comfortable and clean, a bit of mold on the shower curtain. There are some decent places to eat nearby. We had 3 couples and nobody complained about their room. We all thought it was good value for the price we paid. Contrary to others, we found the staff quite helpful and friendly. St Peter's is very close, 5 minute walk. We walked to the city sites (Pantheon, Coliseum etc) in about 20-25 minutes. One day we took the metro back to the hotel, which is close by. We thought the hotel was good

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ActivelyIonic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October for a few days. I can honestly say I have never been spoken to so rudely (or should I say, shouted at). I arrived at 3pm (having been travelling since 4am) to find the room wasn't ready. They asked me to come back in an hour when it would be ready - fair enough... so off I went for 2 hours and came back at 5pm. The room was still not ready. I complained about this (in a pleasant enough manner I have to say) and received such a tirade of abuse from the manager who started with the phrase "now look here little lady...." and was followed by a diatribe about how at any other hotel in Europe you wouldn't be able to get into your room before 8pm..... They eventually found me another room which was exactly the same as the one booked and was ready. The room itself was tiny and the sheets were dirty. There were no blankets. Apart from this it wasn't a bad room for a single room and at least I had a window unlike some of the reviewers on this site. The main problem was the bathroom - it stank! It reeked particularly badly in the mornings and when the room had been shut up all day. It was so bad I can't describe it - it was the drains apparently. I had the misfortune to lock myself out of the room - I don't know what I did but when I came back with the key I couldn't unlock it. I went to the desk for help and the porter tried to help (he was very pleasant unlike other staff members). Unfortunately he couldn't open the door and another member of staff came who got the door unlocked in 2 seconds with a master key and then shouted at me and called me stupid... apparently I had done something to the lock on the inside and had deadlocked it. He said I had greatly inconvenienced him and that I was never ever to do that again (what I'd done I don't know) and that if I did it again he wouldn't let me in. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very poor service, very badly kept”
Reviews.Author: default111
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for 3 nights in the beginning of November.Two of them had been refurbished and the last one was very old so they gave us another one the second day. Even if the rooms seem to be nice on the web, they are badly kept and not well cleaned. The water in the bathtub did not drain off correctly in the old room, the reception desk told us that they were aware of the problem but that they could not fix it.The second night, we found a light bulb which had fallen in the washbasin of a new room and which had switched the electricity of the room. The bathcurtains (if they exist) are mildewed and the walls of the bathtub are crumbling. The woman in charge of the cleaning did not clean the bathroom tablets and let the empty soaps on them. Moreover, she threw to the garbage a tie bought the day before and which was still wrapped. I had to look myself in the garbage can in the street at 11pm to find it. It was dirty so i asked to meet the director the next morning but "he was busy in his office" and i had to be insistent to meet him. Although i had the bill, he did not want to pay for the tie ("Maybe you have let the tie in the trash can of the room...I can not give you a refund here,you have to write to the general management in Napoli and they will asked the assurance and contact you")and after 30 minutes he agreed to sent it to the dry cleaning and he gave us a discount of 20 euros on the total bill(price of tie was 80). The breakfast was very basic but ok. The concierges (the woman and the two men) are sympathic even if they do not take the customers'remarks into account.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Twelve of us stayed in this hotel, we were on a short holiday from work lasting three days. When we arrived we were greeted by a very rude receptionist who did not seem to want to help us in anyway, After seeing the photos of the lobby in the hotel we were shocked to find ourselves looking at old furniture in very bad condition covered in stained dirty material. Breakfast was basic, and the hot water machine broke while one of us was using it and boiling hot water poured out of the tap narrowly missing her hands.The rooms were clean and so were the bedsheets, and the bathroom again was clean and well fitted with a powerful shower, But the service we had from the staff in this hotel was dreadful, the barstaff in particular, We had to check out of the hotel at 11.00am, but our flight wasnt until the evening, so while we were waiting for our taxi we decided to have a drink at the bar, After ordering our drinks we were told that he had no change to go and ask the receptionist for change, who then threw the change at us over the reception desk, when we took the change back to the barman, he became abusive saying when are you going back to england, not soon enough, he then phoned another collegue in the hotel and spoke to him presumably about us in italian, the porter whom he was speaking to then came in to the bar and sprayed excessive air freshener right in our direction making us cough, and then him and his friend the barman fell about laughing, we felt insinuating that something smelt bad in the bar. This man was so rude i was unable to stay in the hotel bar any longer and preferred to stand outside in the cold. Rome was a beautiful city and the location was fantastic. But the service provided by the hotel staff was very very poor indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galem50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. It is about 5 blocks from the gates of St. Peter's Square. More modern with less tourists, convenient by Metro or walking to the main historic center. It is loud if you have a room on the street but most Rome hotes are. It didn't really bother us as that is part of being in Rome. The concierges, especially Donatello and Aldo were terrific. They were very helpful and accomadating. There was another lady concierge that unfortunately we did not think to get her name as she was not there as much but kisses to her for getting us a fabulous reservation for the Restaurant Etoilles up the street (wonderful view of St. Peter's, really expensive but worth the experience). They should think about having the furniture in the downstairs lounge reupholstered as there doesn't seem to be any springs left and offer European as well as awfull American style (I am American, this is expresso with water Ecch) coffee. If you asked they were very nice about getting it for you. Minor criticism though. We got a great deal on Expedia for the rates so shop around. Have a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss!”
Reviews.Author: RaspberryGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and a surprise birthday present. The biggest surprise was seeing the hotel as it didn't look anything like the pictures on the web - they've certainly been artistic with their publicity material. Our trip was taken shortly after the death of the Pope and the city was swarming with journalists. I presume this was the reason the staff tried to palm us off with staff quarters in the basement!! I guess they were hoping to get a much better rate for our room. We had to complain 3 times to get moved. We were offered no explanation for the state of windowless room we were shown to in the basement. It was only after complaining that we were told the hotel was fully booked and they would "move us tomorrow", as the hotel was full. We were only there for 3 nights, and after consideration complained again. We were assured the hotel was completely full. After going out for dinner, we asked to see the manager. We hung around for 20 mins waiting for him to appear and then witnessed a full blown Italian row in the manager's office as he yelled at his staff and refused to see us!! We were however moved by another member of staff to an empty, adequate room, that was mysteriously available, while the arguement continued. The hotel is situated in a good area of Rome, with several good places to eat close by which is lucky because the breakfast is very poor and after the first morning we chose to give it a miss and eat breakfast out. I returned to Rome in August and stayed in a fabulous 4 star hotel, Rome is wonderful but I certainly wouldn't recommend this as a place to stay to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great (Olympic Aurum) Letdown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great disappointment, particularly in view of the superb pictures on the Expedia site. I had booked two twin rooms, 8 months in advance through Expedia.On arrival, reception tried to get me to take one twin and two singles, but 'only for one night, then we'll move you'. The rooms are small; they were both scruffy, the walls covered in black marks. The bathrooms, although a decent size, could do with a good steam cleam to clear the ingrained dirt. The rooms are dark, with bed coverings also of a gloomy nature. The buffet breakfast.....watered down orange juice, dirty glasses, buns and croissant with ham and cheese. Not very good. The superb ppictures depicting the public lounge area...talk about using an airbrush. This room is very small, with well worn furniture. This hotel is really of average 3 star rating, certainly not a four star. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only good thing fromour perspective is that because Rome is such a great place with tons to see, we were out from early in the morning, until late in the evening, thereby not spending much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & value, but NOT 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: misterc6
Reviews.Content: From reading the other reviews I can only conclude that some of you guys are really hard to please! The hotel lists 4 stars, but in reality only rates 3. We stayed three nights and paid €56 per person per night for a comfortable, clean double room with shower, TV, mini bar and the all important air conditioning! That price included breakfast which was great with a wide selection of rolls, croissants, pastries, ham, cheese, salami, hard boiled eggs, yoghurt, cakes & jam. OK the coffee from the dispenser was a bit iffy but just ask the helpful staff for an espresso or capuccino to get the real thing! Tea was also available. The location is brilliant within five minutes walk of the Vatican, much quieter than the centre of town. Even us two wrinklies managed the half hour walk to the Colosseum. There's a produce market right across the road, a street market every day in the Piazza Risorgimento and some reasonable clothes and shoe shops at hand. It's also within easy reach of the Metro and buses. The desk staff are really helpful and their recommendation of one (out of dozens) of local restaurants was so good that we went there twice! Think in terms of a 3 star rather than a 4 star and you'll be pleased to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the rest of these reviews are talking about, or they were staying in a different hotel. The staff were lovely, the cleanliness unfaulted, the rooms were spacious, location just what we were lookig for..... Breakfast was also good. Plenty of choice and lots of it! For the price we paid it was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I could give this property no stars then that's what my rating would be. The location of the hotel was great. It was literally around the corner from the Vatican and a few blocks from a Metro station. There are a few resturants near by and some shops which appear to be used mostly by locals. The hotel was a different story. My husband and I were literally afraid to sleep in the bed. When we arrived, there was nothing but sheets on the bed, no blanket, no comforter. We found a blanket in one of the cabinets in the room. We slept in our clothes on top of the blanket. The walls were dirty and the room smelled as if it had been closed for months possibly years.
