The shower door was broken so it was impossible to take a shower with the door closed. Which turned out to be fine because I didn't want the shower door to touch any parts of my body. When my husband went downstairs to complain, the clerk at the front desk told us there was no availiablity to switch us to another room and that we would have to endure this slum called a hotel room for the remainder of our stay. Fortunately for us we were only in Rome two nights. Our initial thought was that all of the rooms were as yucky as this one. However, the next morning on our way to breakfast we were able to peek into some of the other rooms. Other rooms didn't seem as bad but that was just an initial glance. The breakfast leaves a lot to be desired as well. If ever in Rome, stay at the Grand Olympic at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: benandkate
Reviews.Content: Good location for the Vatican. Rooms in need of update. Breakfast not very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Poor Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was ok, but there are a few points and tips to emphasize. I don't know how it compares with other similar priced hotels in Rome. I looked at the reviews of about 20 hotels and none of them had great reviews; but in terms of location and price this looked the best one to go for. Good points: room was quiet at night, air con worked fine but a little noisy. Maid did a good job cleaning the room and the people on desk were polite. Having read the other reviews on this site I can contribute the consensus of the tiny shower and undrinkable coffee. There was not enough room to swing a mouse in the shower, let alone a cat. The hot water was fine. The cistern on the toilet took forever to fill up (well it is the eternal city!). My main moan was the breakfast. Coffee tasted like gravy, quality of the food was poor. I ended up going to a nearby bar and having a coffee/sandwich. While the hotel is near the Vatican, it is about a mile (25 minute walk) to the historic centre. The metro doesn't go every where and it is advisable to find bus and tram routes, as they pass close to the hotel. There are some nearby resturants in the streets around the hotel that are good value and plenty of shops. This was a budget option and from what I had read about other hotels in the same price category it isn't bad. I got a good nights sleep and the room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but dated”
Reviews.Author: DHM2006
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from the Vatican. Professional service. Good value: we booked late and ended up paying only €75 per night. Rooms were a bit quaint but clean and had effective A/C. A bigger problem was that my wife acquired over 50 insect bites in the course of our first night. The management moved us and there was no further problem.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable - good location”
Reviews.Author: vedaze
Reviews.Content: After a week long cruise of the mediterranean, I stayed here only one night so I'd have a chance to see Rome. The lady at the front was very nice and very helpful, assisting us with what bus tour of the city would be best for us. It is my first and only hotel I've ever stayed in Europe so I can't really compare to other hotels in the area. It is rated 4 star, but of course in U.S. it would never rate as high...kinda looks like an old motel inside. But is clean. There is a "center" corridor to the hotel, which is what our room faced, so we looked at a wall - so if you want a view, try requesting at the desk....it was no biggie to us as we were out all day. Air worked well in our room. The rest of the hotel was warm. Our room was about the same size as a normal hotel room, so not small. Bathroom big but the shower was tiny..had to shower w/the curtain open to make for more room....You have to be open minded as these things are expected as most structures in Rome are old. Didn't check out the hotel bar. Took a glance at the breakfast, but didn't try anything except a cup of coffee - coffee no good - I think it's the "Guiness" of coffees. Go right across the street to the market (mercado). Right when you walk inside there is a little cafe/bar - they have good coffee/cappucino for like .90 euro (about $1 american), plus they have little sandwiches for cheap. There's a cool bus tour called "Open110" or something like that with a red double decker bus.....they'll give you the info at the front desk. It's maybe 30 euro full day/13 for half the day and you can get on and off the bus whenever you want - as there buses goes round and round the city till about 9pm. You get to see all the spots. We thought it was a cool deal.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Quad room received a standard room”
Reviews.Author: jamsmuther
Reviews.Content: We booked the Quad room in Rome because it was cheaper at $300.00 a night for all of us (my three teenagers and myself) to stay in one room, when we arrived we waited 2 hours for our room and then when we saw the room I was mortified. It was a double bed with two cots that you had to pretty much sit on the other bed to get by. My Teenagers feet hung over the cot and they were quite miserable, one even sleep on the floor. They crammed us into one standard room because the quad was not available. I paid in advance and asked for a refund of the difference in price for getting a standard and paying for a quad. It has now been 4 weeks and have not seen a dime. They are now fighting with the internet company I went through saying I got what I paid for. If you are going to book a quad room please be careful at this Hotel as they are not so Honest. Otherwise the city was so beautiful and we walked to every site from the Hotel, but by the end of the night we were very tired but it was the best trip other than the room. Oh yeah, the shutters in our room didn't even open, but we found out why when they starting the construction below and had to listen to pounding all day. Thank goodness we were out most of the day. Good luck on your Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on March, during Easter vacation. The location was great, especially if you want to go to the Vatican area. There's not much cafes in this area. The hotel itself is OK, and the room is a good size for a triple room in Europe. There's no bathtub on the room, only showers and some of the furnitures in the room are very old. The morning breakfast is not so good either. The customer service in the check-in area was very friendly, but if you see the lady in the receptionist, she is kind of rude. All the men in the receptionist are very friendly, but the lady would not give you a friendly service if you don't speak Italian. I wouldn't stay in this hotel again next time I go to Rome. I would try to find a different hotel close to the Vatican or stay in the Bernini Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Olympic is an excellent hotel for use as a basis to walk round the city but make sure you have comfortable walking shoes! Everthing is within reach, from the Villa Borgese to the church of St John Lateran and its just round the corner to the Sistine and St Peters. The staff were welcoming and helpful, even leaving their attention to the TV when Pope Benedict's election was announced as we arrived! If you are claustrophobic avoid a basement room - they have no opening windows! Otherwise the room was comfortable and had all required appointments. Contrary to some comments we found the complimentary continental (cold)breakfast vastly better than we had anticipated with something to suit all tastes and plenty of it. The bar is reasonably priced if miserly on quantity. Unfortunately the basement rooms are close to the breakfast room and service areas which means sleep beyond 6.00 am is difficult. Our travelling companion had a single room on the sixth floor which she found comfortable and quiet apart from the night the reporters had their farewell party when the lift got a little noisy. Would definitely use this hotel again and recommend it to friends. Perhaps we English are more easily satisfied?
